title: Practical Skills & Aptitudes
description: Comprehensive assessment of your practical capabilities and potential across diverse skill areas

questions.question: Which of these skill areas do you feel most confident in? (Select all that apply)

options.label: Analytical reasoning and logical thinking
Creative expression and generating ideas
Writing clearly and persuasively
Speaking, presenting, and explaining ideas
Organizing, planning, and managing projects
Researching, investigating, and finding information
Understanding people and building relationships
Working with numbers, data, and statistics
Using digital tools and learning new software
Hands-on practical work and making things

questions.question: Which type of task do you find comes most naturally to you?

options.label: Analyzing information and drawing conclusions
Creating content, designs, or original work
Coordinating people and managing activities
Persuading and influencing others
Solving puzzles and figuring out how things work
Helping, advising, and supporting others

questions.question: How comfortable are you with reading and interpreting complex information (reports, articles, data)?
questions.minLabel: I find it challenging and slow
questions.maxLabel: I can process complex information easily

questions.question: Which tools and platforms have you used? (Select all that apply)

options.label: Office tools (Word, Excel, Google Docs, Sheets)
Presentation tools (PowerPoint, Google Slides, Canva)
Social media platforms for content or outreach
Design tools (Photoshop, Figma, Canva, etc.)
Data or analysis tools (Excel formulas, SPSS, Tableau)
Project management tools (Trello, Notion, Asana)
Writing or editing platforms (blogs, newsletters, CMS)
Research databases or academic tools
Video or audio production tools
Coding or programming tools
None of these yet

questions.question: When you encounter a mistake or something that isn't working, what's your typical approach?

options.label: Work through it systematically to find the root cause
Look up solutions and learn from others' experiences
Ask someone with more experience for guidance
Try different things until something works
Step back and rethink the overall approach

questions.question: How quickly do you pick up new tools, methods, or ways of working?
questions.minLabel: I need time and practice to feel comfortable
questions.maxLabel: I adapt to new tools and methods quickly

questions.question: What types of projects or activities have you completed? (Select all that apply)

options.label: Written a report, essay, or article
Organized an event, campaign, or initiative
Completed a creative project (design, art, media)
Conducted research or analysis
Led a team or coordinated a group effort
Delivered a presentation or pitch
Built or made something (product, website, prototype)
Taught, tutored, or mentored someone
Participated in community service or volunteering
No significant projects yet

questions.question: How comfortable are you with mathematical and logical reasoning?
questions.minLabel: I prefer to avoid heavy math and logic
questions.maxLabel: I enjoy and excel at math and logic

questions.question: Which type of work interests you most?

options.label: Strategy and planning - shaping direction and goals
Creative production - designing, writing, or producing content
Analysis and insight - understanding data and trends
People and relationships - connecting, advising, supporting
Operations and execution - making things run smoothly
Innovation and development - creating new solutions
Not sure yet - want to explore

questions.question: How much do you enjoy working with visual and aesthetic elements?
questions.minLabel: I focus more on substance and logic
questions.maxLabel: I care deeply about how things look and feel

questions.question: What formal or informal learning have you completed? (Select all that apply)

options.label: University degree (completed or in progress)
Professional courses or workshops
Online courses (Coursera, Udemy, LinkedIn Learning, etc.)
Professional certifications
Self-taught through books, articles, or practice
Mentorship or coaching
None yet

questions.question: Describe the most challenging project or task you've tackled (from school, work, volunteering, or personal life). What made it difficult and how did you approach it?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Organized a major event with limited budget, completed a complex research paper, led a team through a difficult situation...

questions.question: How comfortable are you when instructions are unclear and you need to figure things out on your own?
questions.minLabel: I prefer very clear instructions and guidance
questions.maxLabel: I'm comfortable figuring things out independently

questions.question: What's your relationship with staying current on trends and developments in areas you care about?

options.label: I actively follow news, trends, and developments
I stay aware but focus on what's most relevant
I learn what I need when I need it
I prefer well-established knowledge over trends
I sometimes feel overwhelmed by constant change

questions.question: Which skills do you most want to develop? (Select up to 5)

options.label: Leadership and people management
Public speaking and presentation
Writing and content creation
Data analysis and interpretation
Strategic thinking and planning
Creative and design skills
Negotiation and persuasion
Digital and technical skills
Research and analytical methods
Foreign languages

questions.question: How important is producing high-quality, polished work to you?
questions.minLabel: I prioritize getting things done over perfection
questions.maxLabel: Quality and polish are essential to me

questions.question: How do you feel about receiving feedback and constructive criticism on your work?

options.label: I welcome it - essential for growth
I appreciate constructive feedback
I accept it as part of improving
It's uncomfortable but I try to learn from it
I tend to take it personally at first

questions.question: How much do you enjoy improving and optimizing existing processes or work?
questions.minLabel: I prefer creating new things from scratch
questions.maxLabel: I love making existing things better and more efficient

questions.question: If you could instantly become an expert in one skill or subject, what would it be and why?
questions.placeholder: Think about what excites you most - it could be anything from public speaking to data analysis to design to languages...

questions.question: What topic, subject, or activity do you find yourself naturally drawn to in your free time?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Reading about psychology, creating art, following business news, volunteering, watching documentaries about science...
